result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary R. Kuehn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) - 3rd Offense, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
With Huber and Good Time Credit
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) - 3rd Offense
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: financial statment for failure to pay
inmate request for court date

2:45 pm cases called-15CM343, 16CF57, 16CF58, & 16CF59 and 98FA101. Defendant Gary R. Kuehn in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record-State would move to amend count 1 in 16CF57, 16CF58, & 16CF59 to Misd. Failure to pay Child Support in violation of . Attorney Szilagyi confirms agreement.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Court accepts the amendment by the State.  Plea: No Contest to 15CM343, Count 1 of 16CF57, Count 1 of 16CF58, & Count 1 of 16CF59.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in Count 2 of 16CF57, Counts 2 & 3 of 16CF58 & Counts 2 & 3 of 16CF59. Sentencing argument by ADA Anderson. Sentencing argument by Attorney Szilagyi. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: 16CF57, 16CF58, & 16CF59- SWD and places on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS: Make timely payments as ordered in Waushara County Cases 14FA81, 98FA101 & 01PA2. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
15CM343: 5 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. No credit for time served. To begin no later than April 1, 2017. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 24, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

15CM-343, 16CF-57, 16CF-58 and 16CF-59 - All Cases Called @ 2:27 PM: Defendant Gary R. Kuehn in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD:  All arrears have been PIF through substantial tax intercept from 2015.  Interest still remains which Def expects will almost be satisfied in full with 2016 tax refund.  Asks for one add'l adjournment to completely clear interest - with full payment being accomplished it is believed the State would offer a Misd amendment.  ADA would not be inclined to adjourn further.  SPD concedes a significant amount of interest remains, but will result in a significant benefit to Def on amendment.  SPD believes there is some merit for adjournment today.  The Court reviews last minutes with Defendant.  Further statement by Defendant, requests add'l time to file his taxes - only one remaining current order for a 17 yr old child.  Court will grant the request and P/S adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
1/27/2017 - P/S Hrg - Moved and Left no Forward
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 27, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 16, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

11:06 am cased called-15CM343, 16CF57, 16CF58, & 16CF59. Defendant Gary R. Kuehn in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions parties. Attorney Szilagyi requests one final adjournment for the defendant to file his tax returns from the last year as he has just been released from custody. Court grants adjournment but states this will be the final adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.

15CM-343, 16CF-57, 16CF-58 and 16CF-59 - All Cases Called @ 2:33 PM: Defendant Gary R. Kuehn in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD:  Requests add'l time for Def to raise a lump sum payment - approx late October.  P/S Adjourned as requested.  Per DA:  Confirms that offer extended will take in account lump sum up front payment and voices no objection to adjournment to allow for that payment to be made.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

16CF-57, 16CF-58, 16CF-59 and 15CM-343 - All Cases Called @ 2:55 PM:   Per DA:  Still trying to address restitution between all the cases - serial payer exists with 3 different victims.  Expect to be able to put forth an offer within the next week to 10 days.  P/S requested and scheduled as to all matters.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
State's
Defendant's
Moved Left No Address - NOH Forwarded to WCJ
Status conference on July 20, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Szilagyi requests additional status.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on June 15, 2016 at 10:20 am.

15CM343, 16CF57, 16CF58, 16CF59 cases called at 11:30 am. Defendant Gary R. Kuehn in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaints Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. NGP to 16CM343. 16CF57-16CF59-Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing on all three cases. Court has read the complaints, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Szilagyi confirms receipt, waives formal reading and enters NGP on all three cases/counts.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 10:20 am.
Initial appearance on May 12, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Defendant and SPD Szilagyi

BOND ORDERED AS TO WAUSHARA CO CASE NOS. 2016CF000057, 2016CF000058, 2016CF000059 AND 2015CM000343.  Defendant to maintain payments as ordered as to companion family matters of 98FA-101, 01PA-2 and 14FA-81.   No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

16CF-57, 16CF-58, 16CF-59 and 15CM-343 - All Cases Called @ 1:11 PM: Defendant Gary R. Kuehn in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Defendant Gary R. Kuehn in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD - has not had time to go over the Complaints with Defendant.  CF Complaints Stated.  Def admits receipt of Complaints.  SPD has had no opportunity to review the Complaints w/Def and requests PC statements be read in.   Court finds PC as to the 3 felony matters.  ADA argues as to bond - Signature Bond of approx $10000 w/conditions. SPD has no position on bond.  Court orders global Signature Bond of $10000 with payment of CSUP obligations as to each family order.  15CM-343:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and penalty.  SPD also has not had a chance to review Complaint with Def.  PC Statement read in by Court.  SPD has just rec'd Complaint from Jailer.  Further reading waived.  PC found as to 15CM-343.  ADA argues for global bond as to all matters with the addition of No Drive w/o Valid DL.  SPD has no position on bond.  The Court:  Orders inclusion in CF cases bond - one bond with addition of No Drive conditions.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture
Body Only with Statewide Extradition

Case Called @ 3:18 PM: Defendant Gary R. Kuehn not in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In light of nonappearance, Arrest Warrant authorized with Statewide Extradition.    Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Court orders forfeiture of $250 cash bond previously posted.
